If there’s deadlock at Westminster because nobody can agree what Brexit should look like then the people have to decide. It could be an election or it could be a referendum. This is what happens when people are asked to vote for a vague idea rather than a clear plan

tweets.text:
A special Christmas treat for you all: a new Elections in Wales Blog Post, with more findings from our recent poll with Sky Data. 

This time - party leader ratings:

https://t.co/bh9JuzEJeF

For the second episode of my podcast, The After Party, I was very pleased to be joined at home by @AMCarwyn – just over a week after he stepped down as First Minister.

I hope all of you enjoy listening to it as much as I did recording it: https://t.co/gaphCB9zmf https://t.co/w6NtCnlOtd
This is madness. It looks as if the UK is planning for some kind of war. Time to ask the people to decide  https://t.co/s08oZuhf5F

@AMCarwyn A GE would lead to another Hung Parliament, just with another face in Downing Street failing to negotiate anything else. I’d like a complete Hard Reset on it. A People’s Vote AND a general election. Sod it - let’s have the two on the same day. Would make great TV if nothing else.
@AMCarwyn It’s the only way to break this deadlock. It’s a shame your successor appears to be parroting the Corbyn line that a “Good Brexit” is possible. It’s aspirational, but pure Unicornism.
@AMCarwyn @Amanwy So what was the 1979 referendum? Surely then you mean a third referendum? 79% voted AGAINST devolution in 1979! A resounding result. Oh wait a minute you deny 1979 happened.

@AMCarwyn Break Faith with the People pull the other one its got Brexit on it, FAITH in Government to act, to do what`s best for the people, HAS LONG GONE. WE The people have seen YOUR CIRCUS  the clown can now go to bed. NOW POWER TO THE PEOPLE A PEOPLES VOTE.

@AMCarwyn Good to see you're championing a failed Tory policy then Carwyn.
You seemed to accept the devolution Referendum very quickly, despite a smaller margin than the EU Referendum.

Very proud that a "Bridgend boy" led our nation and our movement for 9 years. From @BryncethinPS & @BryntegSchool to First Minister. Wales is a much fairer and more confident place than it would have been without his leadership. Diolch @AMCarwyn https://t.co/E7F0FPSbhr

.@amcarwyn has been an extraordinary First Minister who has truly delivered for our communities across Wales. Thank you Carwyn for everything you have done for the people of Wales 🌹 https://t.co/d0iPmdWBv2
Best of luck to @MarkDrakeford @fmwales and the new Ministerial team. Pob lwc pawb

@fmwales Thank you First Minister for all your friendship towards Ireland during your term in office. Under your leadership, relations between Ireland and Wales have gone from strength to strength over recent years. All the best to you and your family for the future. Diolch yn fawr iawn.
Good wishes to @fmwales Carwyn Jones. A doughty political opponent but also a man motivated by public service & a challenging but constructive partner to UK govts. https://t.co/ICI1HhoiZR
Thankyou to @AMCarwyn @fmwales for your time as Welsh First Minister delivering the best for Wales. https://t.co/jQ4GLmpq4X
Today was the last time we saw⁦ ⁦@AMCarwyn⁩ as First Minister. Lovely tributes from all sides of the chamber. Diolch Carwyn and pob lwc. We will miss you. https://t.co/cIxdtQINyh

Diolch ⁦@AMCarwyn⁩. 

Copyright:⁦@HirstPhotos⁩ https://t.co/Yp2ZqLUo3F
Diolch o galon @AMCarwyn for all your hard work and passion promoting #Wales in 🇺🇸 as First Minister of Wales over the past 9 years. https://t.co/jKcyqllX9F

As @fmwales @AMCarwyn takes his last First Minister’s Questions, we say thank you for leading our party and our country for the past 9 years. Diolch, Carwyn 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁷󠁬󠁳󠁿🌹#StandingUpForWales https://t.co/afwn6s4baw
A fantastic First Minister @fmwales @AMCarwyn ! Not such a good golfer I can see! Thank you for your service to Wales and @WelshLabour ! Good luck for the future! And enjoy your family!

Congrats to @AMCarwyn @fmwales  for his service. He stands down today as First Minister and has steered us through tough times. I was proud to be there at the start and as my local AM, look forward to working together again in future!
Good to join others to mark @fmwales @AMCarwyn stepping down as First Minister. Someone I’ve worked with for years and always found warm, approachable and thoughtful. https://t.co/F4E9RIJM1u

.@AMCarwyn has been an incredible leader, dedicated servant to the people of Wales, shown real leadership in difficult times & led us to successive election victories. Always encouraging & supportive, his legacy is one of delivery. Good luck Carwyn, thanks for everything. https://t.co/E03XDK5V2P

As it’s @AMCarwyn’s last day as First Minister today, I thought it would be quite fitting to get him a retirement gift. As you can see from the photo, it is themed around the measure I introduced to @AssemblyWales 8 years ago. #FireSafety #sprinklers https://t.co/0CukDdQcdW

Good luck to @AMCarwyn today and for the future. Last day as First Minister after nine years. We went toe-to-toe every week for a lot of that time and whilst we disagree on the politics I respect his commitment to public service and Wales.
Here’s my favourite picture of @AMCarwyn #BeingFirstMinister by @HirstPhotos https://t.co/e8LXRDguFw

£2million EU investment secured by @BridgendCBC to open 30 new starter units at Pyle Industrial Estate & Bridgend Science Park to help more new local businesses set up and grow @DrCharlesSmith @Dhanisha222 @JaneGebbie68 @steveyak81 @AMCarwyn @MadeleineMoon @derekvaughan https://t.co/mqDtVmpsnU
Carwyn’s record as one of the great devolutionists in Welsh Labour history is secure. He’s been a great ambassador for our country. Diolch @AMCarwyn https://t.co/47twcD4epC

Many thanks to Carwyn Jones for working hard for the Welsh economy during his years as First Minister  @fmwales @AMCarwyn
Diolch Carwyn. Just as Rhodri left a great example for you to follow, so you have left for me. Thank you. https://t.co/RBqamkRe2F
We are proud to announce the next leader of @WelshLabour is @MarkDrakeford https://t.co/LCv4ET0CQY

Theresa May met with Carwyn Jones just before heading off to Brussels. He says it will be “miraculous” if her deal gets through Parliament. https://t.co/EbrxxNJxr6

First Minister Carwyn Jones has this afternoon met Theresa May to discuss her Brexit deal. He told me it was the most relaxed and conversational he's ever found her. 'I was sure she thought it was a relief to meet me rather than one of her own backbenchers.' Here's a thread. https://t.co/b5Pq8IcJD5

Rwy’n cwrdd â’r Prif Weinidog heddiw. Mae ganddi  tan ddydd Sul i drefnu bargen sy'n gweithio.
 
Mae Llywodraeth y DU wedi symud yn raddol tuag at y cynllun a gyflwynwyd  gennym 2 flynedd yn ôl -cynllun a allai gael ei dderbyn gan yr EU27 ac ennill mwyafrif yn San Steffan.
Heddiw, rwyf wedi cyhoeddi pecyn o gynigion ariannu ychwanegol ar gyfer llywodraeth leol a fydd yn cael ei gynnwys yn y Gyllideb derfynol #CyllidebCymru https://t.co/KEwBd38s4q
Today I have announced a package of additional funding proposals for local government which will be included in the final Budget #WelshBudget https://t.co/XyOmwrQPqm

Meeting @theresa_may today. The PM has until Sunday to sort out a deal that works. The UK Govt. has slowly moved towards the approach we set out 2 years ago - a position which could be accepted by EU27 and command a majority in Parliament

Pe bai Llywodraeth y DU wedi mabwysiadu’r safbwynt a gynigion ni ddwy flynedd yn ôl am berthynas economaidd sy’n rhoi mynediad llawn i’r farchnad sengl a’r Undeb Tollau, fyddai dim angen unrhyw drefniadau #backstop arbennig ar gyfer Gogledd Iwerddon.

Heddiw rydw i wedi rhoi diweddariad am #Brexit i’r ACau yng nghanol yr argyfwng gwleidyddol gwaethaf a welais erioed. Dydyn ni ddim callach o hyd ynghylch sut berthynas fydd gennym yn y dyfodol gyda’n prif bartner masnach.

If the UK Gov adopted the position we set out almost two years ago for a future economic relationship that included full and unfettered access to the single market and a Customs Union there would be no need to ever invoke any #backstop arrangements.

Today I have provided an update on #Brexit to AMs amidst the worst political crisis I have ever seen. We still have no real idea what the UK’s future relationship with our largest & most influential trading partner will look like.

It was good to welcome @fmwales @AMCarwyn to Islwyn for his visit to the Hangar Youth & Community Centre in Aberbargoed. The @WelshLabour @WelshGovernment continues to invest in funding projects to alleviate youth homelessness. https://t.co/Ynz5cT9L2g
